title: Air Cargo News | The latest supply chain news
content:
Bangladesh authorities have launched an investigation into a major cargo area fire at Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport

Threatened 100% tariffs have triggered a surge in air cargo demand from China to the US with strong demand from the technology and e-commerce sectors

DHL will deploy €300m across Sub-Saharan Africa targeting express, forwarding and supply chain capabilities as the region posts 10% trade value growth in H1

DHL Express and NYU Stern have revised down their global trade volume growth expectations to 2.5% annually through 2029, citing US tariff policy impacts

Airfreight rates from China to the US increased 2.5% week-on-week to $5 per kg last week, reaching levels not seen since mid-August as trade tensions escalate

Magma Aviation is set to expand its fleet before year-end while pursuing network growth in underserved Asian and African markets

US freight forwarders are reporting increased operational costs and compliance complexities following the termination of the de minimis exemption for low-value imports

Freight forwarder Geodis has reached 500 successful flights on its dedicated Asia-Mexico freighter service operated by Atlas Air

Kenyan cargo carrier Astral Aviation has commenced operations on a new China-South Africa route, connecting Haikou with Johannesburg using its Boeing 767-300F

IAG Cargo will expand winter capacity across key trade lanes with frequency increases on existing services and new routes between Dublin and Madrid

Air cargo demand growth decelerated to 3% year-on-year in September, down from 5% in August, as frontloading effects from trade uncertainty began to subside

2025-10-03T07:45:00+01:00 By Alexandra Herdman, senior policy manager, Logistics UK

Recent approvals for runway expansion at Heathrow, Gatwick and Luton present opportunities to boost the UK's 2.6m tonne annual airfreight volumes

The Transpacific trade lane has seen a shake-up this year with the rollout of tariffs and the end of the de minimis exemption, but what are the longer term implications?

FedEx has launched a new weekly service connecting South Korea, Vietnam and China, reducing transit times by one day as intra-Asia trade momentum builds

Ground handler secures partnership to operate new 1.2m-tonne capacity facility at PVG, featuring AI-driven systems and automated processing capabilities

Hong Kong International has reopened its North Runway following repairs after a 747 freighter veered off the runway into the sea, killing two airport security workers
